articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: PacifiCorp agreed to pay $575 million to settle federal claims tied to six wildfires in Oregon and California. The funds will reimburse suppression costs and support land restoration. The settlement resolves allegations only, and the company continues to deny liability.
articles.title: PacifiCorp Agrees to $575 Million Settlement With U.S. Over Six Western Wildfires Including Archie Creek

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Douglas County grand jury returned a no true bill for two Fremont Middle School instructional aides, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges in a case involving injuries to two students. An investigation into a separate teacher at the school remains ongoing.
articles.title: Grand Jury Declines Charges Against Two Fremont Middle School Instructional Aides

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg crews are removing downtown parking meters and installing new signs for free, time-limited parking. The changes expand one-, two-, and three-hour zones and include updated permit fees for city lots and the parking garage. On-street permits will be available once signs are in place.
articles.title: Roseburg Begins Downtown Parking Meter Removal, New Time-Limit Signs Going Up

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Schools will host its final early literacy night March 9 at Rose Elementary for families with children ages 2–4. The free event includes storytelling, hands-on activities and take-home materials for early readers. Registration is required and space is limited.
articles.title: Roseburg Schools To Host Final Early Literacy Night For Young Families March 9

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations including warrants, trespass, probation and stalking order violations, a non-injury crash on NE Stephens Street, driving while suspended, and drinking in public, according to the latest department activity logs.

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Multiple arrests included warrant pickups, a DUII, a fraud/theft case involving stolen credit cards and gift cards, and incidents of trespass and restraining order violations. Several people were also cited or contacted for prohibited camping and related ordinance violations.

articles.author: Rachel McConaghie
articles.description: A Douglas County grand jury issued a "no true bill" for instructors Brian Marsters and Erich Hoque, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges related to injuries sustained by students at Fremont Middle School, including a 13-year-old nonverbal autistic boy;…
articles.title: Roseburg mom pulls kids from Fremont Middle School after son suffers broken arm in class

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is asking for the public's help to find 22-year-old Hannah Elizabeth Olsen from Canyonville.
articles.title: Public's help sought in locating missing Canyonville woman

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Douglas County sheriff's deputies arrested a third suspect Wednesday in an investigation into an incident that injured students at Fremont Middle School, according to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.
articles.title: Roseburg teacher arrested for misconduct at Fremont Middle School
